Author: ENGINEERING KART
title: SOLAR PANEL CLEANING | AUTOMATIC SOLAR PANEL CLEANING SYSTEM
description:
Solar panels work by, allowing light into the solar cells. 
The more light that hits a panel, the more power it will generate. 
Due to the upwards angle, of solar panels, they are more prone to bird droppings, and a build-up of general dust and dirt, that does not wash off with just rain. 
This reduces the amount of light hitting the panel ,and reduces its output. 
As the projected energy figures claimed by solar panel manufacturers, and installers are based on the optimum performance of clean solar panels, 
this build-up of dirt, can adversely affect the panel’s ability, to meet those projections. 
So, it is important to clean solar panels, in order to protect and maintain owners investment.  
Regular solar panel cleaning, will also help, efficient working of the system,
Presently in the manual method,  pressurized water jet is used to clean, the solar panel surface ,as shown in the video.
In this manual method, the human efforts is required, 
Labours are required, to operated this system,
consistency of regular cleaning, is not maintained. 
So, on this present problem, engineering kart team,  tried to introduce, the automatic solar panel cleaning mechanism. 

We support and give Guideline for Fabrication and Manufacturing of  Engineering projects.
Guideline for SYNOPSIS,  PPT, REPORT WRITING. 
Guideline for  Design calculations, and drawings. 
please subscribe for to get updates, also like and share the videos.

----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Suggestions for installing TECHNOVA SPRAY NOZZLES on rooftops/bunglow.

1. Generally every solar panel rooftop has an overhead water tank on the terrace. 
We suggest use of mono block self priming pump (0.5HP - 1HP) for upto 20 panels.
The inlet of the pump can be connected by a flexible suction pipe to the overhead tank.
The 1 inch outlet of the pump, via a reducer can be made 3/4 inch.
The 3/4 inch UPVC pipe goes from pump discharge side upto the nozzles, then pipe is reduced to 1/2 inch dia to get sufficient pressure in nozzles.

2. We recommend use of 1 spray nozzle per panel(1 mtr) or 2 panels one below the other.

3. For people who have submersible pump on the ground floor and want to use the same pump for cleaning solar panels will have to put a 'T' in the pipe. 2 'on' 'off' valve will be required to be fitted on the 2 sides of the 'T'.
While using it for solar panel cleaning, the valve leading to the overhead tank should be closed and vice versa.

4. Incase if needed to clean occasionally entire rooftop manually with pressure water, a separate valve is placed in pump water discharge line.

5. In order to seal gaps between solar panels, sealing tape like
SIKA Multiseal-T tape can be used.
Tape life is claimed to be as long as Solar TV panels.

Author: SolarCleano solar panel cleaning robot
title: SolarCleano F1A - autonomous solar panel dry cleaning robot
description:
The SolarCleano F1A is a fully automated solar panel cleaner especially designed for waterless solar panel cleaning in semi-arid and desertic regions. Its soft rotating brushes apply light pressure to solar panels and efficiently remove thin layer of dust, showing an immediate difference of before/after cleaning. With remote-controlled operating system, this automatic solar robot can be programmed to clean solar panels at night, or even straight after sand storms.

The SolarCleano F1A can be used with robot transporter T1, which moves the cleaning robot automatically from one panel row to the next, safe and fast with no on-site labour required. It is a next-generation smart solution to big solar farms in arid areas.


For more information about our autonomous solutions to solar panel cleaning, please contact: autonomous@solarcleano.com

www.solarcleano.com

Author: Massachusetts Institute of Technology (MIT)
title: How to clean solar panels without water
description:
Cleaning solar panels currently is estimated to use about 10 billion gallons of water per year — enough to supply drinking water for up to 2 million people. A new cleaning method could remove dust on solar installations, improving overall efficiency, without using water. (Learn more: https://news.mit.edu/2022/solar-panels-dust-magnets-0311)

Watch more videos from MIT: http://www.youtube.com/user/MITNewsOffice?sub_confirmation=1

Author: NaanDanJain Marcom
title: SOLAR PANEL CLEANING SOLUTION : “SPARK” BY NAANDANJAIN
description:
The "Spark" micro-sprinkler system is an innovative patented system designed for cleaning and washing solar panels. 
Solar systems require continuous maintenance after installation. Without regular cleaning, the output of the panels decreases significantly, resulting in calcification and corrosion. 
In industrial or agriculture areas, where there is a high percentage of dust in the air, there is a need for more frequent cleaning, which raises maintenance costs. 
"The patent presented in the exhibition, which replaces current hand washing, is economical, easy to assemble and dismantle, easily attached  to almost every solar panel currently on the market and optimizes its washing", says  Maoz Aviv, The company's Chief Agronomist, "The system is modular, does not include moving parts in favor of maintaining a long life span, and is resistant to harsh weather, such as high temperatures, wind and dust. 
This is a unique solution that provides innovation, efficiency and significant operational savings.
keywords: solar panel,green energy,solar energy,solar panel cleaning,solar electricity

Author: Hinren Engineering
title: Automatic Solar Panel Cleaning
description:
Keeping the Solar panels clean is very important in a rooftop solar PV setup. A dirty solar panel reduces efficiency and can also cause hot-spots on the solar panels. 
In most of our projects, to avoid shadow effects, we elevate the structure. However, with elevated structure, cleaning of the panels becomes difficult. So a walkway is provided between solar panels for easy accessibility. 
In spite of a walkway, due to various reasons like paucity of time or due to non-availability of manpower, one needs to have an automatic solar panel cleaning system. 
In this video, we have shown one such system where the solar panels get cleaned automatically every day.
keywords: Solar,panel cleaning,automatic solar panel cleaning,maintenance of solar panels,rooftop solar

title: How To Clean Solar Panels | DIY Solar Panels Cleaning - Dust, Bird Poop 🔥 Step by Step Guide
description:
Cleaning solar panels is as important as servicing a car is. The more you keep your solar panels cleaned, the more electricity they will generate. Be it just the dust that needs to be washed away or the bird poop or the leaves, all these can be removed easily.

In this video, I've shown how to clean solar panels on the roof. This DIY solar panels cleaning video is a step-by-step guide that can help anyone who has recently installed solar panels at their home and is unaware of how to do the solar panels maintenance.

Solar Panels Cleaning - Step-by-Step Guide

Step 1: Clean solar panels with some water
Step 2: Wipe the solar panels with a mop or a wiper
step 3: through some more water for the final cleaning

cleaning your solar panels

----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Suggestions for installing TECHNOVA SPRAY NOZZLES on rooftops/bunglow.

1. Generally every solar panel rooftop has an overhead water tank on the terrace. 
We suggest use of mono block self priming pump (0.5HP - 1HP) for upto 20 panels.
The inlet of the pump can be connected by a flexible suction pipe to the overhead tank.
The 1 inch outlet of the pump, via a reducer can be made 3/4 inch.
The 3/4 inch UPVC pipe goes from pump discharge side upto the nozzles, then pipe is reduced to 1/2 inch dia to get sufficient pressure in nozzles.

2. We recommend use of 1 spray nozzle per panel(1 mtr) or 2 panels one below the other.

3. For people who have submersible pump on the ground floor and want to use the same pump for cleaning solar panels will have to put a 'T' in the pipe. 2 'on' 'off' valve will be required to be fitted on the 2 sides of the 'T'.
While using it for solar panel cleaning, the valve leading to the overhead tank should be closed and vice versa.

4. Incase if needed to clean occasionally entire rooftop manually with pressure water, a separate valve is placed in pump water discharge line.

5. In order to seal gaps between solar panels, sealing tape like
SIKA Multiseal-T tape can be used.
Tape life is claimed to be as long as Solar TV panels.


Please Support and Subscribe to The Future Is Solar

Author: Drip Automation Systems
title: Solar Panel Cleaning Automation.#Jain Automation
description:
SPARK Sprinkler and Irricare Controller Automation:
          The "Spark" micro-sprinkler system is an innovative patented system designed for cleaning and washing solar panels. Solar systems require continuous maintenance after installation. Without regular cleaning, the output of the panels decreases significantly, resulting in calcification and corrosion. In industrial or agriculture areas, where there is a high percentage of dust in the air, there is a need for more frequent cleaning, which raises maintenance costs. "The patent presented in the exhibition, which replaces current hand washing, is economical, easy to assemble and dismantle, easily attached to almost every solar panel currently on the market and optimizes its washing"

Why clean solar panels?
               Airborne dust particles, sticky tree and plant sap, lichen, soot and bird droppings are just a few of the things that can contribute to a build-up of dirt on your panels. Accumulation creates shading and will prevent sunlight reaching the cells. This results in poor system performance, loss of efficiency and a loss of financial return for the owner and investor of solar energy. 

Dirty solar panels :
• Lose efficiency and lifespan 
• Reduce overall system performance
• May cause permanent module staining
• See a loss of return on investment
• Affect your limited warranty
Regular cleaning :
• Ensures a maximum output
• Maintains your warranty
• Saves you money
• Extends the life of your investment
• Prevents permanent module staining
• Gives you peace of mind 

                               Solar panel cleaning activity depends on the type of dirt that is present on the modules. The best time to wash your solar panels is when they are not hot. Also, the preferred time is early in the morning or in the evening. Cleaning them mid-day may break the glass, or if it does not break, you can damage the glass/metal seal because of the high temperatures. Research indicates that cleaned solar panels have the capacity of more than 20 % better functionality than the ones that are not regularly cleaned. Therefore, regularly clean the solar panels to maintain their efficiency.
.

Author: Sagar Goswami
title: Nozzle spray or sprinkler system for cleaning solar panels.
description:
EVOLUTION SOLAR ROOFTOP CLEANING SYSTEM 

Your purchase of solar panels represents a significant investment. Allowing solar panels to become dirty due to airborne particles, bird droppings, and tree leaves can greatly diminish your solar power output. In other words, you are not getting the production you paid to get. If solar panels are never cleaned you lose a significant amount of power.

WHY THIS SYSTEM IS REQUIRED ?

A car that’s well-oiled and serviced runs better, so there’s no surprise that solar panels do their job more efficiently when they’re given the same level of attention.

You could be losing up to the following percentages per year, if cleaning isn’t on your agenda:

Year 1: 15% Energy Loss
Year 2: 25% Energy Loss
Year 3: 35% Energy Loss
Year 4: 40% Energy Loss

ADVANTAGES OF THE SYSTEM 

1. Gain as much as 5 to 30% in output from Solar panels.
2. Eliminate build-up of dirt, debris and potential damage to solar panels.
3. Increase life of Solar panels.
4. Sprinklers on this system are warranted for two years.
5. Sprinklers are made of Brass (No plastic)
6. Sprinklers are made in India.
7. Easy to operate.

Author: Cueball Private Limited
title: Solar Panel Cleaning System: How to clean solar panels in India with less water
description:
How to clean solar panels efficiently and easily. Time saving and affordable way of cleaning solar panels for your home and business. It is an optimal and economical solution for the cleaning and washing of solar panels. The efficiency of the panels means income to users. You can be rest assured that your solar energy facility is producing electricity optimally. 

For more energy efficient/savings video please visit: https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCZB6lvCNiW4lViOpTH8NCgQ


GO Solar with us: http://cueball.co.in/
Follow us on facebook: https://www.facebook.com/cueballpvtltd/



In order for the solar panels to properly absorb sunlight to give maximum output, they must be as clean as possible. Once there is dirt of any kind - sand, dust and even bird droppings - on the surface of the panels, they become less efficient, and the production of electricity is compromised. Air pollution is also a culprit or heavily polluted industrial areas require attention and frequent cleaning.


There is energy loss  if panels are not cleaned regularly. Both small and large scale PV systems are immensely affected by dust deposition on solar panels.



Solar energy particularly has become more affordable. Solar Photovoltaic (PV) is one of the renewable energy sources with the greatest future projection as it possesses features such as simple installation, high reliability, low maintenance cost. 



The increasing cost effectiveness of solar electricity, has led to more and more of the earth’s surface being covered with solar panels. Both households and industries are generating electricity in this way. 

Benefits
1. Increase Electricity generation: Enables the system to keep producing more efficiently.

2. Saves Money: No need to hire any cleaning services.
3. Saves Labourr: Manual cleaning of the panels is not required.
4. Saves Time: No time invested in maintaining and cleaning the system.
5. Safety: Eliminates the need for elevated handling and cleaning risks.

Features
1. Unique adjustable unit that fits most panels in the market.
2. The unit maintains steady, well-aligned micro- sprinklers on the panels for optimal cleaning.
3. Uniform cleaning of the panel.
4. The unit is free of vibration while cleaning the solar panels, unlike other solutions in the market.
5. All components are modular and easy to assemble without a need for special tools. 
6. Easy, user-friendly assembling and dismantling of the unit on the panel.
7. Two kinds of water distribution for best coverage of the area: The main unit consists of a 180° static diffuser, while the second unit consists of a 90° static diffuser for use on the edges and boundaries. 

8. Non-rotating parts for a long life span even under tough conditions, such as high temperatures, wind and dust.

Email : technovasolarspray@gmail.com
New contact: +91 9082858645.(Do not contact on number at end of video)

Suggestions for installing TECHNOVA SPRAY NOZZLES on rooftops/bunglow.

1. Generally every solar panel rooftop has an overhead water tank on the terrace. 
We suggest use of monoblock self priming pump (0.5HP - 1HP) for upto 20 panels.
The inlet of the pump can be connected by a flexible suction pipe to the overhead tank.
The 1 inch outlet of the pump, via a reducer can be made 3/4 inch.
The 3/4 inch UPVC pipe goes from pump discharge side upto the nozzles, then pipe is reduced to 1/2 inch dia to get sufficient pressure in nozzles.

2. We recommend use of 1 spray nozzle per panel(1 mtr) or 2 panels one below the other.

3. For people who have submersible pump on the ground floor and want to use the same pump for cleaning solar panels will have to put a 'T' in the pipe. 2 'on' 'off' valve will be required to be fitted on the 2 sides of the 'T'.
While using it for solar panel cleaning, the valve leading to the overhead tank should be closed and vice versa.

4. Incase if needed to clean occasionally entire rooftop manually with pressure water, a separate valve is placed in pump water discharge line.

5. In order to seal gaps between solar panels, sealing tape like
SIKA Multiseal-T tape can be used.
Tape life is claimed to be as long as Solar TV panels.

Author: ENGINEERING KART
title: SOLAR PANEL CLEANING | AUTOMATIC SOLAR PANEL CLEANING SYSTEM
description:
Solar panels work by, allowing light into the solar cells. 
The more light that hits a panel, the more power it will generate. 
Due to the upwards angle, of solar panels, they are more prone to bird droppings, and a build-up of general dust and dirt, that does not wash off with just rain. 
This reduces the amount of light hitting the panel ,and reduces its output. 
As the projected energy figures claimed by solar panel manufacturers, and installers are based on the optimum performance of clean solar panels, 
this build-up of dirt, can adversely affect the panel’s ability, to meet those projections. 
So, it is important to clean solar panels, in order to protect and maintain owners investment.  
Regular solar panel cleaning, will also help, efficient working of the system,
Presently in the manual method,  pressurized water jet is used to clean, the solar panel surface ,as shown in the video.
In this manual method, the human efforts is required, 
Labours are required, to operated this system,
consistency of regular cleaning, is not maintained. 
So, on this present problem, engineering kart team,  tried to introduce, the automatic solar panel cleaning mechanism. 

We support and give Guideline for Fabrication and Manufacturing of  Engineering projects.
Guideline for SYNOPSIS,  PPT, REPORT WRITING. 
Guideline for  Design calculations, and drawings. 
please subscribe for to get updates, also like and share the videos.  
Contact us:-
Email Id:- infoengineeringkart@gmail.com
Website:- www.engineeringkart.in
contact:- 09922001011

Author: Allterra Solar
title: How To Clean Your Solar Panels
description:
Cleaning Your Solar System 
 
Congratulations on going solar! Whether your installation occurred last week or many years ago, it is important to know how to keep the panels clean to maximize production and cost savings. While rain is helpful in keeping the system clean, it is recommended that you clean the array(s) every few years. It is especially important if you live in an area with a lot of dust, pollen, birds, leaves, pine needles, or if there has been a recent fire. Moreover, you can check your system’s production to determine whether it is time to clean the panels. 
 
Consider contacting the manufacturer or the installer for specific cleaning instructions. Please keep in mind that panels can be very hot during the middle of the day so cleaning in the morning or evening is suggested. 
 
Professional Cleaning 
 
The best and most convenient way to clean your system is to hire a professional cleaning service. As solar has grown around the world, so have auxiliary services like panel washing companies. There are a few quality companies servicing the Central Coast that you can find with a simple Google search. The cost is typically $100-$200 depending on the specifics of your system like roof pitch and number of arrays. 

Do It Yourself
 
If you feel comfortable getting on your roof, you can clean the system yourself. A hose and a non-abrasive rag will suffice. Using distilled or deionized water is best but municipal water works fine. Using soap isn’t recommended as it can leave a film or residue that not only shades panels, but it can also encourage dirt to stick and build up faster. The most important thing is to not scratch the glass! Another critical note is that spraying cold water on hot glass can lead to cracking so make sure to clean in the morning or in the evening when temperatures are lower.

Author: Hinren Engineering
title: Automatic Solar Panel Cleaning
description:
Keeping the Solar panels clean is very important in a rooftop solar PV setup. A dirty solar panel reduces efficiency and can also cause hot-spots on the solar panels. 
In most of our projects, to avoid shadow effects, we elevate the structure. However, with elevated structure, cleaning of the panels becomes difficult. So a walkway is provided between solar panels for easy accessibility. 
In spite of a walkway, due to various reasons like paucity of time or due to non-availability of manpower, one needs to have an automatic solar panel cleaning system. 
In this video, we have shown one such system where the solar panels get cleaned automatically every day.
keywords: Solar,panel cleaning,automatic solar panel cleaning,maintenance of solar panels,rooftop solar

Author: ToolboxDIY
title: How To Clean Solar Panels | Like a Pro!
description:
I’ll show you How To Clean Solar Panels like a pro so you can improve the efficiency of your investment. 

For those of you with a sloped roof, I recommend staying in one spot and using the water fed pole brush I use in the video. You also use an extension pole for your squeegee or just skip this step all together. Cleaning solar panels can be dangerous so exercise caution and good judgment.

Author: Landing Zone Home
title: How to Clean Solar Panels and Improve Performance
description:
Learn how to clean your solar panels and maybe improve the performance of your solar system. I clean my panels once a year but if your area has infrequent rain or a lot of dust you may have to clean more often. Be careful when in high positions and take precautions not to trip on wiring or slip on wet or soap covered surfaces.

Author: robdude1969
title: DIY - How to Clean Your Solar Panels the Easy Way (if you dare climb on your roof safely)
description:
DISCLAIMER  - Climbing on your roof is dangerous. DO SO AT YOUR OWN RISK! Wear safety harness and use protection if in doubt. I VERY STRONGLY SUGGEST DOING THIS ON A COOL DAY OR IN THE MORNING BEFORE THE PANELS HEAT UP. DAMAGE CAN OCCUR IF YOU PUT COLD WATER ON HOT PANELS.
Solar panel cleaning will help you restore efficiency to your solar system. 
Solar Panels are awesome! Go Green, Help save the earth with clean energy!
If you are still reading this, I am betting you already agree and want to clean your solar panels. Solar panels get dusty, dirty, covered with pollen and the rain doesn't always clean it off. I use Liquid Dish Soap and a window cleaner's squeegee. It's a mild soap, cleans glass great, and rinses off easily. 
Again it's very important to do this when it's cool out and panels are cool to the touch. If the panels are hot, the soap dries quickly and the job becomes more difficult. These glass panels are built to get hot and cold slowly, but I wouldn't suggest testing the thermal variance with cold water. I use a simple pole and soft mop that you may already have at home in the video, but there are professional level options available below. Again, BE SAFE - KNOW YOUR LIMITS - IF IN DOUBT CONTACT A PROFESSIONAL!

Get your cleaning supplies here from these affiliate links.

Author: Massachusetts Institute of Technology (MIT)
title: How to clean solar panels without water
description:
Cleaning solar panels currently is estimated to use about 10 billion gallons of water per year — enough to supply drinking water for up to 2 million people. A new cleaning method could remove dust on solar installations, improving overall efficiency, without using water. (Learn more: https://news.mit.edu/2022/solar-panels-dust-magnets-0311)

----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Suggestions for installing TECHNOVA SPRAY NOZZLES on rooftops/bunglow.

1. Generally every solar panel rooftop has an overhead water tank on the terrace. 
We suggest use of mono block self priming pump (0.5HP - 1HP) for upto 20 panels.
The inlet of the pump can be connected by a flexible suction pipe to the overhead tank.
The 1 inch outlet of the pump, via a reducer can be made 3/4 inch.
The 3/4 inch UPVC pipe goes from pump discharge side upto the nozzles, then pipe is reduced to 1/2 inch dia to get sufficient pressure in nozzles.

2. We recommend use of 1 spray nozzle per panel(1 mtr) or 2 panels one below the other.

3. For people who have submersible pump on the ground floor and want to use the same pump for cleaning solar panels will have to put a 'T' in the pipe. 2 'on' 'off' valve will be required to be fitted on the 2 sides of the 'T'.
While using it for solar panel cleaning, the valve leading to the overhead tank should be closed and vice versa.

4. Incase if needed to clean occasionally entire rooftop manually with pressure water, a separate valve is placed in pump water discharge line.

5. In order to seal gaps between solar panels, sealing tape like
SIKA Multiseal-T tape can be used.
Tape life is claimed to be as long as Solar TV panels.

Author: Hinren Engineering
title: Automatic Solar Panel Cleaning
description:
Keeping the Solar panels clean is very important in a rooftop solar PV setup. A dirty solar panel reduces efficiency and can also cause hot-spots on the solar panels. 
In most of our projects, to avoid shadow effects, we elevate the structure. However, with elevated structure, cleaning of the panels becomes difficult. So a walkway is provided between solar panels for easy accessibility. 
In spite of a walkway, due to various reasons like paucity of time or due to non-availability of manpower, one needs to have an automatic solar panel cleaning system. 
In this video, we have shown one such system where the solar panels get cleaned automatically every day.
keywords: Solar,panel cleaning,automatic solar panel cleaning,maintenance of solar panels,rooftop solar

Author: Cueball Private Limited
title: Solar Panel Cleaning System: How to clean solar panels in India with less water
description:
How to clean solar panels efficiently and easily. Time saving and affordable way of cleaning solar panels for your home and business. It is an optimal and economical solution for the cleaning and washing of solar panels. The efficiency of the panels means income to users. You can be rest assured that your solar energy facility is producing electricity optimally. 

For more energy efficient/savings video please visit: https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCZB6lvCNiW4lViOpTH8NCgQ


GO Solar with us: http://cueball.co.in/
Follow us on facebook: https://www.facebook.com/cueballpvtltd/



In order for the solar panels to properly absorb sunlight to give maximum output, they must be as clean as possible. Once there is dirt of any kind - sand, dust and even bird droppings - on the surface of the panels, they become less efficient, and the production of electricity is compromised. Air pollution is also a culprit or heavily polluted industrial areas require attention and frequent cleaning.


There is energy loss  if panels are not cleaned regularly. Both small and large scale PV systems are immensely affected by dust deposition on solar panels.



Solar energy particularly has become more affordable. Solar Photovoltaic (PV) is one of the renewable energy sources with the greatest future projection as it possesses features such as simple installation, high reliability, low maintenance cost. 



The increasing cost effectiveness of solar electricity, has led to more and more of the earth’s surface being covered with solar panels. Both households and industries are generating electricity in this way. 

Benefits
1. Increase Electricity generation: Enables the system to keep producing more efficiently.

2. Saves Money: No need to hire any cleaning services.
3. Saves Labourr: Manual cleaning of the panels is not required.
4. Saves Time: No time invested in maintaining and cleaning the system.
5. Safety: Eliminates the need for elevated handling and cleaning risks.

Features
1. Unique adjustable unit that fits most panels in the market.
2. The unit maintains steady, well-aligned micro- sprinklers on the panels for optimal cleaning.
3. Uniform cleaning of the panel.
4. The unit is free of vibration while cleaning the solar panels, unlike other solutions in the market.
5. All components are modular and easy to assemble without a need for special tools. 
6. Easy, user-friendly assembling and dismantling of the unit on the panel.
7. Two kinds of water distribution for best coverage of the area: The main unit consists of a 180° static diffuser, while the second unit consists of a 90° static diffuser for use on the edges and boundaries. 

8. Non-rotating parts for a long life span even under tough conditions, such as high temperatures, wind and dust.

Author: Nevon Projects
title: Solar Seawater Desalinator & Water Purifier Machine | Seawater to Drinking Water
description:
The machine makes use of a 3 stage process to convert salty seawater to pure drinkable water. The system first allows user to pour salty water via a mesh based inlet where large waste like plastic granules or stones, weed etc gets separated. This water is then pumped into a large purification chamber having 3 layers of purifiers including sand and gravel for filtering weed, sand and large salt particles.

Download Free Document and get details at https://nevonprojects.com/solar-seawater-desalination-machine-with-ro-uv-purifier/

The output of this process is still salty water but without any particles. This water is then passed on to the second filtration where we use reverse osmosis to filter out salt from the water. Here we use 3 filtration membranes to filter out fresh water from salty water and trap the salt particles in membrane filters.

This water is now stored in a tank just above the system.

Author: Rohit Brahmbhatt
title: Solar rooftop PV panels Auto cleaning (DIY)
description:
Using Technova nozzles (yellow) and Rainbird pop-up sprinkler-4" nozzle- 18 VAN (black), I have made  solar rooftop auto cleaning (DIY) system. This is 3.9kw (325 watts x 12 nos Waree panels) Solar PV roofop system. All 12 nos of PV panels are placed in one slope.3 panels are kept side by side and in 4 raws. So that with minimum use of water,minimum use of nozzles,minimum size of water pump(1/2 hp monoblock), without using any additional pressure pump booster switch, all panels can be cleaned. It is cleaned in just 2 mins only. No wastage of water(used water directly goes in garden). It's Water pump control switch is kept at ground floor. It will be operated with Android application base timer switch lateron. Thus it will be completely automatic operation. With Android application, it can be switched OFF/ON and it's time setting can be done with remotely accessed from any place and any where through mobile application. The water pump is kept just near the over head tank.All solar rooftop PV panels, 0.5 HP monoblock water pump and overhead water tank are just located  side by side at bungalow terrace. The solar rooftop PV panel structure is designed in such a way that solar rooftop looks like a weather shed. No much drilling are required for fixing solar rooftop structure on terrace flooring. This is to minimize any water penetration through anchor bolts which are drilled to hold two pillars/legs of rooftop structure.Thus Entire terrace floor is free for use.
Materials used:

Half HP monoblock water pump(Harsh make)

3/4"dia. UPVC pipe from pump discharge side upto nozzles, then pipe is reduced to 1/2"dia. to get sufficient pressure in nozzles
3 - Nos Technova make (yellow)specially designed nozzles for cleaning solar panels.(available online on Indiamart)whattsup no.9082858645 and see link https://youtu.be/PduE2UjCE40

1 - Nos Rainbird(black) Pop-up sprinkler 4"nozzle 18VAN, to clean panels thoroughly beyond 12' length from top end.(Available on Amazon)

Notes: In case ,if needed to clean occasionally entire rooftop manually with pressure water , a separate valve is placed in pump water dischage line.

Specially porpose meant for sealing solar panel gap , a special tape is used, SIKA multiseal -T tape, to seal a gap between panels. So that water flows down totally without any leaking from panel gaps. It is designed for UV protection.As per universal reviews, it's life is as long as Solar PV panel's life.

By regular cleaning efficiency in solar power generation is increasing to @26%...See this video

https://youtu.be/9gvOGiBp3lU

Author: kapson tekno engineers
title: Automatic solar panel cleaning system (without water)

Author: ENGINEERING KART
title: SOLAR PANEL CLEANING | AUTOMATIC SOLAR PANEL CLEANING SYSTEM
description:
Solar panels work by, allowing light into the solar cells. 
The more light that hits a panel, the more power it will generate. 
Due to the upwards angle, of solar panels, they are more prone to bird droppings, and a build-up of general dust and dirt, that does not wash off with just rain. 
This reduces the amount of light hitting the panel ,and reduces its output. 
As the projected energy figures claimed by solar panel manufacturers, and installers are based on the optimum performance of clean solar panels, 
this build-up of dirt, can adversely affect the panel’s ability, to meet those projections. 
So, it is important to clean solar panels, in order to protect and maintain owners investment.  
Regular solar panel cleaning, will also help, efficient working of the system,
Presently in the manual method,  pressurized water jet is used to clean, the solar panel surface ,as shown in the video.
In this manual method, the human efforts is required, 
Labours are required, to operated this system,
consistency of regular cleaning, is not maintained. 
So, on this present problem, engineering kart team,  tried to introduce, the automatic solar panel cleaning mechanism.

► The main objective of the project is to measure the power of the 
     solar panel with or without load along with a cleaning system.

Author: Multihog
title: Solar Panel Cleaning Machine - Multihog
description:
Video of a brand new attachment for the Multihog tractor - a solar panel cleaning brush! 

We will be back with more details soon, but our expected data from testing shows: 

• Capacity is up to 10,000 square meters (11,960 sq. yds) per hour.

• Early calculations by customer predicts cost of cleaning 1 panel with this brush is €0.35 compared to cost of cleaning with manpower €2.25

• A 1MW farm normally contains 3800 - 4000 panels, and the time needed to clean the entire farm is approx. 3 hours with the Multihog/brush combo versus approx. 8 manpower hours.


A Multihog multi-purpose tractor is the perfect machine for maintaining solar farms. Once the panel cleaning is finished, simply swap out the brush for one of our many front or rear-mounted attachments, to keep your machine working 365 days per year! 

Contact us today for more info, or to arrange a demo - email info@multihog.com!

Author: ENGINEERING KART
title: SOLAR PANEL CLEANING | AUTOMATIC SOLAR PANEL CLEANING SYSTEM
description:
Solar panels work by, allowing light into the solar cells. 
The more light that hits a panel, the more power it will generate. 
Due to the upwards angle, of solar panels, they are more prone to bird droppings, and a build-up of general dust and dirt, that does not wash off with just rain. 
This reduces the amount of light hitting the panel ,and reduces its output. 
As the projected energy figures claimed by solar panel manufacturers, and installers are based on the optimum performance of clean solar panels, 
this build-up of dirt, can adversely affect the panel’s ability, to meet those projections. 
So, it is important to clean solar panels, in order to protect and maintain owners investment.  
Regular solar panel cleaning, will also help, efficient working of the system,
Presently in the manual method,  pressurized water jet is used to clean, the solar panel surface ,as shown in the video.
In this manual method, the human efforts is required, 
Labours are required, to operated this system,
consistency of regular cleaning, is not maintained. 
So, on this present problem, engineering kart team,  tried to introduce, the automatic solar panel cleaning mechanism. 

We support and give Guideline for Fabrication and Manufacturing of  Engineering projects.
Guideline for SYNOPSIS,  PPT, REPORT WRITING. 
Guideline for  Design calculations, and drawings. 
please subscribe for to get updates, also like and share the videos.

Author: Hinren Engineering
title: Automatic Solar Panel Cleaning
description:
Keeping the Solar panels clean is very important in a rooftop solar PV setup. A dirty solar panel reduces efficiency and can also cause hot-spots on the solar panels. 
In most of our projects, to avoid shadow effects, we elevate the structure. However, with elevated structure, cleaning of the panels becomes difficult. So a walkway is provided between solar panels for easy accessibility. 
In spite of a walkway, due to various reasons like paucity of time or due to non-availability of manpower, one needs to have an automatic solar panel cleaning system. 
In this video, we have shown one such system where the solar panels get cleaned automatically every day.
keywords: Solar,panel cleaning,automatic solar panel cleaning,maintenance of solar panels,rooftop solar

The handheld device weighs in at 5.5 pounds (2.5 Kg) and resembles a large digital camera with a touchscreen. AiRTouch acquires images with the push of a button and can wirelessly transmit them to PACS (clinical image storage system), without the need for a computer. Its battery charges within two hours and can capture up to 300 exposures per charge. Its portability has already made it useful in drive-through screening centers in South Korea, according to the company.

description:

Solar panels in the Middle East are subject to a lot of soiling due to the amount of sand in the region. Water is scarce and costly when it comes to wet cleaning.

Cleaning done in Dubai.

description:
The GEVA-BOT is a revolutionary portable PV cleaning robot invented by Israeli entrepreneur Eli Geva.
Patended No. 61869076

The GEVA-BOT operates on a new technology which allows the robot to be:
* Extremely fast
* Super efficient against all kinds of dirt
* Light weighted for mobile purposes
* And most importantly - more affordable than any cleaning solution on the global market in 2017.

That means that you only need 1 GEVA-BOT + 1 employee, to handle an entire solar field, no matter the size. And all there is to do, is simply move the light weighted GEVA-BOT to the next row of panels.
The more GEVA-BOTs the faster it will be, as seen by the GEVA-BOT team in the video.

Constructed to exact dimensions and requirements of your solar system.

Author: Voltora Industries
title: AirTouch 4 | Instructional Video
description:
Thank you for your AirTouch 4 purchase with Voltora Industries.
This video is a brief instructional video on how to use your AirTouch 4.

For more inquiries please contact us on 1300 799 430 or visit http://www.voltoraindustries.com.au

Thank you for choosing Voltora for your recent purchase of the AirTouch 4 Smart home control system.
This is a short instructional video on how you can use the system to its full capabilities.
We will start on the master controller. To turn the system on or off, tap the power button at the top of the screen or push and hold the button in the lower right corner. From here we can set the modes from Cooling, heating, fresh air, dry, or automatic. We can also set the fan speed between low, medium, high, and automatic.
Your system has individual temperature controls throughout the house to allow us to adjust each individual temperature and airflow to each zone. To increase or decrease the temperature we can use the positive or negative buttons. The percentage is what shows how much the temperature is adjusted. It can be adjusted by 5 percent increments from 0 to 100.

Author: Unreasonable
title: Smart Robots Clean Solar Panels Nightly | Ecoppia
description: Ecoppia is driving the solar power revolution by enabling year-round peak panel performance and lowering LCOE (levelized cost of energy). A pioneer and world leader in automation and robotics for large-scale solar panel cleaning, Ecoppia offers a cloud-based, connected platform and a suite of robotic solutions for smart management of solar plants. The Ecoppia AI platform can independently initiate cleanings, using machine learning to optimize maintenance as well as harvest billions of data points for advanced analytics and operational insights for plants. With over nearly 3,200MW of deployments, 13 patents, and 1.56 billion solar panels cleaned worldwide, Ecoppia’s fully autonomous solutions are completely water-free, energy independent, and self-cleaning — making their technology both eco-friendly and cost effective. Ecoppia aims to make the green energy space greener by bringing high-quality technologies and innovations to the solar industry, and enabling solar expansion to remote areas suffering from electricity poverty. Ecoppia is one of the fastest growing companies in Israel, with a global portfolio and the goal of automating all Tier 1 energy companies in the next three years.

description:
The Pegasus an automatic solar panel cleaning system: 

  Cleans the solar panel, that too on just a simple click by your finger tip.

Author: SAUR ENERGY
title: EXCLUSIVE INTERVIEW WITH NALIN SHARMA VICE PRESIDENT-ASIA ECOPPIA
description:
I Would Praise the Govt for Meticulously Planning and Executing Solar Policy in India: Nalin Sharma , VP Ecoppia Asia 
As utility solar becomes competitive; companies are vigorously undergoing enhancements in efficiency and production. Automated systems and digital adoption is driving every corner of the industrial sector. In strive to automate the traditional and inefficient solar cleaning processes; Ecoppia’s robots are well poised to make a transformative effect in the perverse cleaning solution segment. The company's autonomous and water-free solar array cleaning solution frugally keeps photovoltaic panels at peak performance, even in extreme geographical conditions. In talks with Niloy Banerjee, Associate Editor, Saur Energy International; Nalin Sharma, Vice President – Asia, Ecoppia illustrates on the canvas of this ground-breaking ‘automating’ revolution and also confabs on the prospects which are set to sweep the solar corridors.

Author: Allterra Solar
title: How To Clean Your Solar Panels
description:
Cleaning Your Solar System 
 
Congratulations on going solar! Whether your installation occurred last week or many years ago, it is important to know how to keep the panels clean to maximize production and cost savings. While rain is helpful in keeping the system clean, it is recommended that you clean the array(s) every few years. It is especially important if you live in an area with a lot of dust, pollen, birds, leaves, pine needles, or if there has been a recent fire. Moreover, you can check your system’s production to determine whether it is time to clean the panels. 
 
Consider contacting the manufacturer or the installer for specific cleaning instructions. Please keep in mind that panels can be very hot during the middle of the day so cleaning in the morning or evening is suggested. 
 
Professional Cleaning 
 
The best and most convenient way to clean your system is to hire a professional cleaning service. As solar has grown around the world, so have auxiliary services like panel washing companies. There are a few quality companies servicing the Central Coast that you can find with a simple Google search. The cost is typically $100-$200 depending on the specifics of your system like roof pitch and number of arrays. 

Do It Yourself
 
If you feel comfortable getting on your roof, you can clean the system yourself. A hose and a non-abrasive rag will suffice. Using distilled or deionized water is best but municipal water works fine. Using soap isn’t recommended as it can leave a film or residue that not only shades panels, but it can also encourage dirt to stick and build up faster. The most important thing is to not scratch the glass! Another critical note is that spraying cold water on hot glass can lead to cracking so make sure to clean in the morning or in the evening when temperatures are lower.

Author: Sunbank Solar
title: How the Evacuated Tube Solar Water Heater Collector Works
description:
Product in this video: https://thesunbank.com/products

In this video we show you the heart of the Sunbank solar water heater: the evacuated tube solar collector. The vacuum tube collector is the most popular solar collector in the world and excels in cloudy and cold conditions. Any solar collector can make heat when it's hot and sunny outside, but the evacuated tube outperforms other collectors when you have less than ideal conditions, giving you more consistent year-round heat.

Author: Sofo Soler
title: Cleaning Solar Water Heater | Solar Maintenance | Servicing | Sofo-Soler
description:
The constant flow of water in the system leads to corrosion of heaters which, in turn, leads to the failure of solar water heaters. To keep the heater remain rust-free for a longer period of time, dry it out when it is not in use. Vegetation growth and dust accumulated on the collectors can become a cause of concern due to its continuous usage. Therefore, it needs to be cleaned regularly.

Periodic maintenance of solar water heaters is necessary every 3 to 5 years. Check for any kind of leakage in the pipes, tank, tubes, etc as leakage is very common in these areas. Ensure that the tubes are kept dust-free. If you find any crack in the insulation, make sure to have it replaced immediately.

In the case of hard water, scale deposits will be observed in the tubes and the tank. If there are any plumbing issues, contact your plumber to sort the problem effectively.

Contact us on 5251 5321 if you need more info

#SolarMaintenance #Mauritius #Servicing

Author: RENVU Solar Equipment Distribution
title: Cleaning Solar Panels 101 — Why & How | RENVU
description:
https://www.renvu.com/Learn/Solar-Panel-Cleaning-Why-How-101

To be honest, in most cases you won’t need to clean your solar panels because the rain will do most of the work for you. However, rain won’t always be able to come to the rescue if you have lots of birds in your area leaving their droppings, or if you just don’t get that much rain in the first place.

So... how much of an impact does dirt have on your panels?

Not by much honestly. UC San Diego researchers found that panels had a loss of 7.5% in efficiency after 145 days of no cleaning of any sort, rain or other means.

However, if you have a large system or the amount of dirt on your solar panels lowers your efficiency significantly, then it makes sense to clean your panels.

If you do not have the proper equipment to ensure your safety or a proper cleaning, or you have a large or a particularly dirty solar system, it might be best to hire a professional solar panel cleaning company to come out.

So how do you go about cleaning your solar panels if you want to do it yourself?

Make sure you are staying safe first of all! The simplest way to clean solar panels is with plain water, using a hose and a soft sponge. If you have stubborn spots, avoid using harsh tools and cleaners, and opt for a gentle soap/cleaner. Just make sure to wash it all off afterward.

What about if solar panels have snow on them?

You can either wait for the snow to slide off, or use a modified snow rake with a sponge or a soft squeegee-like strip on the end. Make sure to avoid any hard/harsh tools that might damage your panels.

Author: RPS Solar Pumps
title: Dirty vs Clean Solar Panel - Power Output Comparison and HowTo
description:
Why clean your panels every year??  Check out this video to see, how a simple 5 minute cleaning can significantly boost your power output!

These are also some of the highest quality 100W available panels available in the USA today.  You can purchase them directly at:
https://www.amazon.com/RPS-Monocrystalline-Solar-Battery-Charging/dp/B07JLSX21Z

We hooked up a dirty solar panel to a constant voltage  DC electronic load. We set the voltage to 36V and found that our dirty panels were outputting about 4 Amps which is equivalent to about 145 Watts. Once we cleaned the panels, we saw in increase to 5.1 Amps (183 Watts), which is the full power you can expect in typical conditions. 

The amperage data was linearly mapped to a visual power meter to show the decrease or increase in power in real time.

The dirty panels were outputting 26% less power than when fully clean.

Author: Nev's Garage
title: Solar Hot Water System Service Part 2 : Cleaning INSIDE the Roof Mounted Heat Exchanger
description:
In this episode we remove the glass panel from the Heat Exchanger and give her a spruce-up.

This part of the system is used to draw the heat from the sun rays into the cold water that is circulated from the storage tank below by the electric pump.

The more sun the unit can harvest, the more effective it will be at heating up your water.

A video demonstrating replacement of the electric pump can be found here : https://youtu.be/G7FxV3DB-8E

Solar panels convert sunlight into electricity, but less so when they are dirty.
Dust and dirt reduce the performance of solar panels. 
This results in an important waste of green energy and money.

HELIOS is an automated cleaning service for solar panels. 
It’s a fully autonomous system that can access difficult-to-reach places and eliminates dangerous and costly work. 
Our service results in more efficient panels which 
- produce more green energy,
- generate more financial return

After the service is ordered, our system is delivered to your home. Small cleaning robots that can move autonomously over the panels are placed on the solar installation using a drone platform. cleaning your solar panels

----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Suggestions for installing TECHNOVA SPRAY NOZZLES on rooftops/bunglow.

1. Generally every solar panel rooftop has an overhead water tank on the terrace. 
We suggest use of mono block self priming pump (0.5HP - 1HP) for upto 20 panels.
The inlet of the pump can be connected by a flexible suction pipe to the overhead tank.
The 1 inch outlet of the pump, via a reducer can be made 3/4 inch.
The 3/4 inch UPVC pipe goes from pump discharge side upto the nozzles, then pipe is reduced to 1/2 inch dia to get sufficient pressure in nozzles.

2. We recommend use of 1 spray nozzle per panel(1 mtr) or 2 panels one below the other.

3. For people who have submersible pump on the ground floor and want to use the same pump for cleaning solar panels will have to put a 'T' in the pipe. 2 'on' 'off' valve will be required to be fitted on the 2 sides of the 'T'.
While using it for solar panel cleaning, the valve leading to the overhead tank should be closed and vice versa.

4. Incase if needed to clean occasionally entire rooftop manually with pressure water, a separate valve is placed in pump water discharge line.

5. In order to seal gaps between solar panels, sealing tape like
SIKA Multiseal-T tape can be used.
Tape life is claimed to be as long as Solar TV panels.

Author: Hinren Engineering
title: Automatic Solar Panel Cleaning
description:
Keeping the Solar panels clean is very important in a rooftop solar PV setup. A dirty solar panel reduces efficiency and can also cause hot-spots on the solar panels. 
In most of our projects, to avoid shadow effects, we elevate the structure. However, with elevated structure, cleaning of the panels becomes difficult. So a walkway is provided between solar panels for easy accessibility. 
In spite of a walkway, due to various reasons like paucity of time or due to non-availability of manpower, one needs to have an automatic solar panel cleaning system. 
In this video, we have shown one such system where the solar panels get cleaned automatically every day.
keywords: Solar,panel cleaning,automatic solar panel cleaning,maintenance of solar panels,rooftop solar

Author: GIRIRAJ ELECTRONICS
title: Wi Fi Based Solar Panel Cleaning System
description:
Keeping panels clean is crucial for optimum energy production of any Solar Plants.



Operation & Maintenance of Large Solar Plants requires huge Capital & Labour intensive process as well as High Maintenance cost of cleaning System itself.


Traditional cleaning method involves huge amount of Maintenance cost as well as Man power. Even after this, the life of panels is reduced considerably because of scratches due to dusting removal process.



To resolve all the above issues, GIRIRAJ Introduce i-Smart Solar Panel Cleaning System.

Features of the i-Smart Solar Panel Cleaning System are as under:
No Man Power Required: Because GIRIRAJ Panel Cleaning System is operated without any ground staff!!!



Remote operation over Wi-Fi: Complete system works remotely on Wi-Fi. 


Remote operation over Internet: Possible to operate the system over Internet from anywhere in the World.


Maintenance Free: No User Serviceable Parts are used in the system. Hence no need for periodic Maintenance like replacement of Wiper blade, BLDC Motor, Battery Pack, Cleaning Brush, Cleaning Pad, Belt, Pulley, Bearing, Flexible Water Hose, Hose connection etc…


Shadow free Operation: Even during cleaning time the system is 100% Shadow free. 


Time Saving: Capable to clean 1MW Panels within 30 to 45 Min. (i.e. Single system is capable to clean the 1 MW Plant panels within Max. 45 Min.)


Increases life of toughened glass: As during cleaning process nothing is in Contact with glass. Hence No chance of scratch during cleaning process.


Save Money: As this system is Human less, no need to pay salary for Panel Cleaning Maintenance staff. As no serviceable parts are used in the system, Maintenance cost for the system is almost Zero.


100% Human Safety: As complete system is operated remotely, 100% Human safety & saves Human lives.


Plant Safety: Physical damage to the plant due to human mistake by Driving etc. is 100% avoided. Because of this the plant is more safe.


Increase power Generation: By Regular cleaning of the panels one can get up-to 30% more energy production. This enables the plant to run on Optimum Level. 


Low Power Consumption: Variable from 0.5 HP to 5 HP.
Contact us for Dealership / Distributorship 

Technical Specifications:
Installation Type: Permanent Fix System.



Operation Mode: Over Wi-Fi (By Default), Over Internet against specific requirement.


Software: Android for Wi-Fi. (Provided with user ID & password)


Suitable Plant Size: 100% Customized.


Protection: The system provides protection to the panel against damage. If Module Temperature is high the system will indicate the same & will not start the cleaning process.


For more information please visit our website:
https://www.girirajsystems.com

The GEVA-BOT is a revolutionary portable PV cleaning robot invented by Israeli entrepreneur Eli Geva.
Patended No. 61869076

The GEVA-BOT operates on a new technology which allows the robot to be:
* Extremely fast
* Super efficient against all kinds of dirt
* Light weighted for mobile purposes
* And most importantly - more affordable than any cleaning solution on the global market in 2017.

That means that you only need 1 GEVA-BOT + 1 employee, to handle an entire solar field, no matter the size. And all there is to do, is simply move the light weighted GEVA-BOT to the next row of panels.
The more GEVA-BOTs the faster it will be, as seen by the GEVA-BOT team in the video.

Constructed to exact dimensions and requirements of your solar system.

Author: ENGINEERING KART
title: SOLAR PANEL CLEANING | AUTOMATIC SOLAR PANEL CLEANING SYSTEM
description:
Solar panels work by, allowing light into the solar cells. 
The more light that hits a panel, the more power it will generate. 
Due to the upwards angle, of solar panels, they are more prone to bird droppings, and a build-up of general dust and dirt, that does not wash off with just rain. 
This reduces the amount of light hitting the panel ,and reduces its output. 
As the projected energy figures claimed by solar panel manufacturers, and installers are based on the optimum performance of clean solar panels, 
this build-up of dirt, can adversely affect the panel’s ability, to meet those projections. 
So, it is important to clean solar panels, in order to protect and maintain owners investment.  
Regular solar panel cleaning, will also help, efficient working of the system,
Presently in the manual method,  pressurized water jet is used to clean, the solar panel surface ,as shown in the video.
In this manual method, the human efforts is required, 
Labours are required, to operated this system,
consistency of regular cleaning, is not maintained. 
So, on this present problem, engineering kart team,  tried to introduce, the automatic solar panel cleaning mechanism.

Author: Taypro - Empowering Renewable Energy
title: How automatic solar panel cleaning robot work - Explained | Taypro
description:
Maintaining a solar plant is the most difficult task which all the solar plant owners face. Almost 30% of energy annually is lost due to problems like dust generation on the solar panel (Soiling), Spots generated on the solar panel glass (scaling) or maybe due to bird dropping. when bird dropping stays on the solar modules for a longer time, it generates hotspots on the solar module which damages the solar panel and reduces its efficiency. while cleaning, when high pressure water is sprayed on the solar panels, it damages the glass of the modules as well as it creates micro cracks in the solar cells.
All these issues can be solved with a simple solution!
A waterless automatic solar panel cleaning robot in india by taypro, can solve these issue without applying any pressure on the solar panel glass. The weight of the device is acting on the frame of the solar module which is evenly distributed and hence the total load which is acting on the solar module is not even 5% of the total load for which typical solar panels are tested.
Even cleaning of entire panel cleans almost all types of dry dust with soft cloth with the speed of 20 Panels/Min. the automatic solar panel cleaning robot can be controlled remotely from any device over internet with advanced monitoring dashboard. Its self charging monocrystalline modules can charge its inbuilt battery daily in the peak hours without any external power source. So once it is installed on the solar modules, set a timer and stop worrying about your plant, taypro's automatic solar panel cleaning robot will clean those daily.

Author: Saiyam Agrawal
title: CleanSweep: The Floor Cleaning Robot- Part 1 | Constructing | DIY
description:
Part 1: This video will show the instructions to build the robot.
Part 2 of the project where you can see the robot in action: https://youtu.be/B92vy_2ewfg

If this project helped you in some or the other way, you can:
Buy Me a Coffee: https://ko-fi.com/saiyam

Instagram: http://instagram.com/saiyam_rakh
Instructables: http://instructables.com/member/saiyam
Telegram: https://t.me/saiyamagrawal

Written Step by Step procedure on instructables: https://www.instructables.com/id/CleanSweep-the-Floor-Cleaning-Robot/
Schematic: https://cdn.instructables.com/F88/KCNQ/J20PGENZ/F88KCNQJ20PGENZ.LARGE.jpg
Code download link: https://cdn.instructables.com/ORIG/FS2/AQ56/J20PFGE4/FS2AQ56J20PFGE4.ino
Instructions for uploading the code: https://www.instructables.com/id/CleanSweep-the-Floor-Cleaning-Robot/#step9
Link for app: https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=nextprototypes.BTSerialController&hl=en
Instructions for configuring the app: https://www.instructables.com/id/CleanSweep-the-Floor-Cleaning-Robot/#step11
____________________
CleanSweep is a smartphone controlled robot that cleans your house's floor! The rotating mops on the front of the robot along with a foam roller (used to paint walls, not here) at the back can do the job perfectly. There's also a water pump and water reservoir which can be switched on when required to throw water on the floor and make the mops moist for a proper clean. The foam roller is movable, which means you can lift it when not in use. I've also added speed controls for the driver motors.

The project uses bluetooth communication via an HC-05 bluetooth module to send the commands to the most commonly used microcontroller- Arduino UNO. The robot is powered on a 12V lead acid battery, the ideal voltage for all motors used here.. The driver motor pair are 100rpm ones while for the mops I've used 75rpm plastic ones.

The best part is that the mops used were homemade, from old CDs and rags and they clean just perfectly. This is a smaller version so might not be suitable for a large area. There can be tons of other features added, like making it completely autonomous, which I couldn't due to shortage of time.

It took me around 4-5 days to complete this thing, simultaneously making videos of the process. I hope you like it.

Parts Required:
-2x 100rpm Geared motors
-2x Wheels for motors
-2x 75rpm Plastic geared motors w/ wheels
-1x Arduino UNO
-1x HC-05/06 bluetooth module
-1x L293D motor driver board
-1x Standard servo motor (180 degree rotation)
-1x 12V Sealed lead acid rechargeable battery
-1x 12V Water pump
-2x TIP31C/TIP122 NPN power transistors
-2x Old CDs
-A paint roller w/ shaft
-Wiping cloth/ napkin/ old rags
-A needle and thread
-Vinyl tubing
-Rainbow wire
-Male-male/ female-female/ male-female jumper wires
-Male/female headers
-Perforated board
-Nuts and Screws
-Plywood base
-Paint roller w/ shaft
-A 600ml plastic bottle

Author: Nevon Projects
title: Solar Floor Cleaner Robot With Vacuum Cleaning | Robotics Project
description:
Solar floor cleaner with vacuum cleaner and wet cleaning and added obstacle sensing using ultrasonic sensor.

Get complete project details and documents at https://nevonprojects.com/solar-vacuum-cleaner-floor-cleaner-robot/

Here we present a solar based floor cleaner robot that makes cleaning outdoor spaces, terraces, open restaurants, large campus etc very easy. The system is made to help cleaners clean large open spaces without any physical effort and without the need to constantly charge the robot.
The robot is made to provide following features:

Easy and instant cleaning
Vacuum Cleaning for dust collection
Water tank and brush for wet cleaning

Author: SerbotSwitzerland
title: Serbot pvClean- cleaning robot for solar/pv panels and glass surfaces
description:
The Serbot pvClean is an efficient and attractively priced solar panel / glass surface cleaning device for inclination angles of maximum 15°.

Field-proven technical solutions from our successful GEKKO Solar robot are implemented in the Serbot pvClean. With identical brush and supply hose attachments and related power/water connections, the brushes and the supply hoses are interchangeable between both systems. 


Moving and handling is easy  - no need for a lift or any other support systems - Serbot pvClean’s modular and weight optimized design allows manual movement and placement on the surface to be cleaned.

Author: Saiyam Agrawal
title: CleanSweep: The Floor Cleaning Robot- Part 1 | Constructing | DIY
description:
Part 1: This video will show the instructions to build the robot.
Part 2 of the project where you can see the robot in action: https://youtu.be/B92vy_2ewfg

If this project helped you in some or the other way, you can:
Buy Me a Coffee: https://ko-fi.com/saiyam

Instagram: http://instagram.com/saiyam_rakh
Instructables: http://instructables.com/member/saiyam
Telegram: https://t.me/saiyamagrawal

Written Step by Step procedure on instructables: https://www.instructables.com/id/CleanSweep-the-Floor-Cleaning-Robot/
Schematic: https://cdn.instructables.com/F88/KCNQ/J20PGENZ/F88KCNQJ20PGENZ.LARGE.jpg
Code download link: https://cdn.instructables.com/ORIG/FS2/AQ56/J20PFGE4/FS2AQ56J20PFGE4.ino
Instructions for uploading the code: https://www.instructables.com/id/CleanSweep-the-Floor-Cleaning-Robot/#step9
Link for app: https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=nextprototypes.BTSerialController&hl=en
Instructions for configuring the app: https://www.instructables.com/id/CleanSweep-the-Floor-Cleaning-Robot/#step11
____________________
CleanSweep is a smartphone controlled robot that cleans your house's floor! The rotating mops on the front of the robot along with a foam roller (used to paint walls, not here) at the back can do the job perfectly. There's also a water pump and water reservoir which can be switched on when required to throw water on the floor and make the mops moist for a proper clean. The foam roller is movable, which means you can lift it when not in use. I've also added speed controls for the driver motors.

The project uses bluetooth communication via an HC-05 bluetooth module to send the commands to the most commonly used microcontroller- Arduino UNO. The robot is powered on a 12V lead acid battery, the ideal voltage for all motors used here.. The driver motor pair are 100rpm ones while for the mops I've used 75rpm plastic ones.

The best part is that the mops used were homemade, from old CDs and rags and they clean just perfectly. This is a smaller version so might not be suitable for a large area. There can be tons of other features added, like making it completely autonomous, which I couldn't due to shortage of time.

It took me around 4-5 days to complete this thing, simultaneously making videos of the process. I hope you like it.

Parts Required:
-2x 100rpm Geared motors
-2x Wheels for motors
-2x 75rpm Plastic geared motors w/ wheels
-1x Arduino UNO
-1x HC-05/06 bluetooth module
-1x L293D motor driver board
-1x Standard servo motor (180 degree rotation)
-1x 12V Sealed lead acid rechargeable battery
-1x 12V Water pump
-2x TIP31C/TIP122 NPN power transistors
-2x Old CDs
-A paint roller w/ shaft
-Wiping cloth/ napkin/ old rags
-A needle and thread
-Vinyl tubing
-Rainbow wire
-Male-male/ female-female/ male-female jumper wires
-Male/female headers
-Perforated board
-Nuts and Screws
-Plywood base
-Paint roller w/ shaft
-A 600ml plastic bottle

Author: Bhuvana Adi
title: MILAGROW Redhawk 21 | Wet Mopping Demo
description:
#Milagrow #RedHawk21 #robotic

I bought this on Amazon -
https://amzn.to/31woAi4
Also available on Flipkart -
http://fkrt.it/KrqSXRuuuN
Or you can buy on their website -
https://milagrowhumantech.com/floor-vacuuming-robots/1143-redhawk-21-684753682784.html
SOLD OUT AS OF NOW!!
Just wait for stocks to arrive !!!!
============================================================
I have already shown the unboxing of this robotic cleaner in my earlier video. You can watch that here -
https://youtu.be/yBeve656wvY

I have also uploaded a video showing the parts and functions. You can watch that here -
https://youtu.be/yBeve656wvY
In this video, I have shown the demo of filling water in the tank, fixing the wet mop and also some 4 minutes of wet mopping.
Since it dry sweeps and sucks the dust before, mopping is quite effective.
And it uses very little water, hence the drying of the floor after mopping is very quick.
And one tank full of 110 ml water can mop upto 600 to 700 sq feet comfortably.
If the mopping starts becoming dry, we have to fill the tank again.
There is no indicator or alarm for low water in the tank or empty tank.

Hope you like this video!
Thanks for all the love and support!

Author: Nevon Projects
title: Eco Friendly Road Footpath Cleaner Machine Semi Automatic Mechanical Floor Cleaner
description:
Download Project Details at https://nevonprojects.com/manually-operated-eco-friendly-road-and-floor-dust-cleaning-machine/

ch as electric motors, diesel engines, and robots are being used to clean the floor, road. But such processes create abundant pollution, maintenance and are very tough to carry out. So, in order to save energy and save nature, there is a need to develop, user-friendly road and floor cleaning machine. A machine which should be operated manually so that it can be as an alternative for conventional electric cleaning machine. The dust cleaning machine system is fixed with a pair of wheels which are connected with the help of shaft. The shaft makes the wheels connected to one and other. The wheels are moved to the desired position with the help of manual force, which can handle is provided to move. The handle can be adjusted for a required height and are provided three adjusting holes for it. A chain drive is connected to the wheels and gear at each side. The chain is moved according to the wheel and gear. The brush moving the alternative direction of the wheels move and the brush brooms the waste present on the road also it dumps the waste into the waste-collecting box. The waste collection box is removed to dump the waste into desired places.

This is best for working couples who can set the robot to do the household cleaning when they move 
out from their home for work.

First run is important as that will create the map, the rooms and you will be able to view the cleaning path. There is a LDS laser navigation system with 8m scanning range. This system with the SLAM algorithm work in real time, mapping the area for higher accuracy.

The robot also comes with sensors that can detect falls so as the robot does not fall off the staircase for example. Well not just these there is anti collision, anti drop and other high precision sensors. 

Mi Robot Vacuum-Mop P Specs

3200 mAh battery
2.4GHz Wi-Fi
60 to 130 minutes running time
3.6KG weight
33W power
LDS Laser Navigation System
2100 pa powerful suction
12 high precision sensor
Intelligent mapping and route planning
Automatic recharge and resume
8m scanning range

Author: Australis Engineering
title: UniRing MAX industrial floor cleaning robot
description:
The MAX autonomous industrial floor cleaning robot by UniRing (Taiwan) washes, scrubs and vacuums industrial floor surfaces. Once a cleaning schedule is programmed, MAX can run AUTOMATICALLY! MAX makes cleaning more efficient.

MAX is ideal for large areas of hard flooring, including Hospitals, Universities and Schools, Airports, Convention Centres, Shopping Centres, Entertainment Venues, Sports Arenas, Theatres, Museums and more. Its even suitable for cleaning products that are proven to help clean coronavirus.

MAX’s In-House Core Tech system is designed to avoid barriers and undertake route planning. MAX can operate in complex, real-world environments, with SAFETY as its top priority. MAX uses an intelligent navigation system and can reliably determine a safe working route to complete its cleaning tasks.

In most applications requiring cleaning of large areas, several MAX robots will be required to perform the task successfully. To source your fleet of MAX robots, Australis offers operating lease options to help you get up and running quickly. Operating leases are subject to a credit check and terms and conditions do apply.

MAX is manufactured and supplied by UniRing who are based in Taiwan. Australis Engineering are the local Australian partner for UniRing. For more information see: https://australiseng.com.au/

(Note, in this video, the MAX robot is not performing its wet scrub function. This is because we were not permitted to use water on the timber floors. MAX is using its vacuum function only in this video).

The product comes with 1-year warranty. Its cleaning type includes an auto mode for general cleaning, scheduled mode, full-GO (maximum clean) mode, edge clean for corners, spot cleaning mode for cleaning a particular zone, and manual mode, allowing the user to steer the robot. It also has a wet cleaning mode, making it all together to give options of sweeping, vacuuming and mopping damp or wet floors.
Tank Capacity - 150 ML & Dust Box Capacity - 250 mlThis has a universal turbo brush system which ensures it to tackle multiple surfaces.
It has an anti-collision feature, with the help of anti-drop and anti-bump sensors.
It lasts up to 120 minutes of work (with a full charge), it also automatically docks and charges, and is always prepared to clean the floor.
 The unit can also be controlled by using the app ‘Tuya Smart’ and over a WiFi connection from your phone or connected home automation devices (Amazon Alexa and Google Home).

Author: SerbotSwitzerland
title: Serbot pvClean- cleaning robot for solar/pv panels and glass surfaces
description:
The Serbot pvClean is an efficient and attractively priced solar panel / glass surface cleaning device for inclination angles of maximum 15°.

Field-proven technical solutions from our successful GEKKO Solar robot are implemented in the Serbot pvClean. With identical brush and supply hose attachments and related power/water connections, the brushes and the supply hoses are interchangeable between both systems. 


Moving and handling is easy  - no need for a lift or any other support systems - Serbot pvClean’s modular and weight optimized design allows manual movement and placement on the surface to be cleaned.

solar panel cleaning robot india



Water is a scarce commodity in a country of nearly 1.4 billion people, and the use of water in energy generation is a big concern. The rise of solar and wind generation is significant as they not only curb air pollution but also tend to use less water compared to thermal generation.

That said, solar projects do use some water primarily for cleaning panels. Cleaning of solar modules is a big challenge for developers, especially in arid and dry zones where water is scarce, particularly water that is suitable for cleaning solar modules.

The life of solar modules is usually guaranteed for 25 years, and throughout its life span, cleaning is essential for efficient power generation, which ultimately impacts the bottom line.

Dust particles, bird droppings, and other particulate materials lead to a decrease in energy generation, highlighting the importance of solar module cleaning. While manual cleaning is one of the options, several robotic technologies have entered the market that provides a cost-effective method to clean solar panels as compared to manual cleaning. Some of the more common types of robotic cleaning systems include: module cleaning robots, driving robots, and AI-enabled robots.


Speaking about the latest technologies entering the robotic cleaning market, Aayushman Goyal, senior management, product development at Ganges Internationale, said, “The latest technologies include trolleys that can facilitate movement between two rows in a plant, which will bring down the CAPEX (capital expenditure) significantly. Infusion of thermal imaging cameras with robotic cleaners is another new technology that will shape the future, as it gives plant owners the ability to detect and fix any hotspots that may arise on their modules.”

Authorities have also noticed increased water usage in solar projects. Last year, the Ministry of New and Renewable Energy (MNRE) recommended the efficient utilization of water for cleaning utility-scale solar projects. The ministry said that project developers are currently using too much water to clean solar modules, and they should try and minimize wastage. The ministry also recommended the use of robotic cleaning technology.

Author: Saiyam Agrawal
title: CleanSweep: The Floor Cleaning Robot- Part 1 | Constructing | DIY
description:
Part 1: This video will show the instructions to build the robot.
Part 2 of the project where you can see the robot in action: https://youtu.be/B92vy_2ewfg

If this project helped you in some or the other way, you can:
Buy Me a Coffee: https://ko-fi.com/saiyam

Instagram: http://instagram.com/saiyam_rakh
Instructables: http://instructables.com/member/saiyam
Telegram: https://t.me/saiyamagrawal

Written Step by Step procedure on instructables: https://www.instructables.com/id/CleanSweep-the-Floor-Cleaning-Robot/
Schematic: https://cdn.instructables.com/F88/KCNQ/J20PGENZ/F88KCNQJ20PGENZ.LARGE.jpg
Code download link: https://cdn.instructables.com/ORIG/FS2/AQ56/J20PFGE4/FS2AQ56J20PFGE4.ino
Instructions for uploading the code: https://www.instructables.com/id/CleanSweep-the-Floor-Cleaning-Robot/#step9
Link for app: https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=nextprototypes.BTSerialController&hl=en
Instructions for configuring the app: https://www.instructables.com/id/CleanSweep-the-Floor-Cleaning-Robot/#step11
____________________
CleanSweep is a smartphone controlled robot that cleans your house's floor! The rotating mops on the front of the robot along with a foam roller (used to paint walls, not here) at the back can do the job perfectly. There's also a water pump and water reservoir which can be switched on when required to throw water on the floor and make the mops moist for a proper clean. The foam roller is movable, which means you can lift it when not in use. I've also added speed controls for the driver motors.

The project uses bluetooth communication via an HC-05 bluetooth module to send the commands to the most commonly used microcontroller- Arduino UNO. The robot is powered on a 12V lead acid battery, the ideal voltage for all motors used here.. The driver motor pair are 100rpm ones while for the mops I've used 75rpm plastic ones.

The best part is that the mops used were homemade, from old CDs and rags and they clean just perfectly. This is a smaller version so might not be suitable for a large area. There can be tons of other features added, like making it completely autonomous, which I couldn't due to shortage of time.

It took me around 4-5 days to complete this thing, simultaneously making videos of the process. I hope you like it.

Parts Required:
-2x 100rpm Geared motors
-2x Wheels for motors
-2x 75rpm Plastic geared motors w/ wheels
-1x Arduino UNO
-1x HC-05/06 bluetooth module
-1x L293D motor driver board
-1x Standard servo motor (180 degree rotation)
-1x 12V Sealed lead acid rechargeable battery
-1x 12V Water pump
-2x TIP31C/TIP122 NPN power transistors
-2x Old CDs
-A paint roller w/ shaft
-Wiping cloth/ napkin/ old rags
-A needle and thread
-Vinyl tubing
-Rainbow wire
-Male-male/ female-female/ male-female jumper wires
-Male/female headers
-Perforated board
-Nuts and Screws
-Plywood base
-Paint roller w/ shaft
-A 600ml plastic bottle

Author: Taypro - Empowering Renewable Energy
title: How automatic solar panel cleaning robot work - Explained | Taypro
description:
Maintaining a solar plant is the most difficult task which all the solar plant owners face. Almost 30% of energy annually is lost due to problems like dust generation on the solar panel (Soiling), Spots generated on the solar panel glass (scaling) or maybe due to bird dropping. when bird dropping stays on the solar modules for a longer time, it generates hotspots on the solar module which damages the solar panel and reduces its efficiency. while cleaning, when high pressure water is sprayed on the solar panels, it damages the glass of the modules as well as it creates micro cracks in the solar cells.
All these issues can be solved with a simple solution!
A waterless automatic solar panel cleaning robot in india by taypro, can solve these issue without applying any pressure on the solar panel glass. The weight of the device is acting on the frame of the solar module which is evenly distributed and hence the total load which is acting on the solar module is not even 5% of the total load for which typical solar panels are tested.
Even cleaning of entire panel cleans almost all types of dry dust with soft cloth with the speed of 20 Panels/Min. the automatic solar panel cleaning robot can be controlled remotely from any device over internet with advanced monitoring dashboard. Its self charging monocrystalline modules can charge its inbuilt battery daily in the peak hours without any external power source. So once it is installed on the solar modules, set a timer and stop worrying about your plant, taypro's automatic solar panel cleaning robot will clean those daily.
